Description: Head of terracotta figure of deer. A head and forequarters broken from a figure of a deer, modelled in the round. Hand-modelled; facial details incised. Micaceous brown Nile silt, covered overall with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3741)
Condition: Very little of the chest remains and only the start of the forelegs. The antlers that rise from the top of the head are broken, and the ears and the muzzle are damaged.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
